snippets.script:
<script>
    import {DateTimeStamp} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const timestamp = "2021-11-10T13:00:42-05:00";
</script>

<DateTimeStamp hour="numeric" hour_12 {timestamp} />
snippets.title: DateTimeStamp 12 Hour

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {DateTimeStamp} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const timestamp = "2021-11-10T13:00:42-05:00";
</script>

<DateTimeStamp
    day="2-digit"
    month="long"
    weekday="long"
    year="2-digit"
    hour="2-digit"
    minute="2-digit"
    second="2-digit"
    hour_12
    {timestamp}
/>
snippets.title: DateTimeStamp Custom Format

data.text: DateTimeStamp NOTE : Introduced feature in v0.4.10. DateTimeStamp formats an ISO 8601 / RFC 3339 timestamp into a human readable string, using the user preferences provided by the Browser. <script> import {DateTimeStamp} from "@kahi-ui/framework"; const timestamp = "2021-11-10T13:00:42-05:00"; </script> <DateTimeStamp {timestamp} /> Imports <script> import {DateTimeStamp} from "@kahi-ui/framework"; </script> 12 Hour You can have the timestamp render as 12-hour time (1...12 AM/PM) instead of 24-hour time (0...23) via the hour_12 property. <script> import {DateTimeStamp} from "@kahi-ui/framework"; const timestamp = "2021-11-10T13:00:42-05:00"; </script> <DateTimeStamp hour="numeric" hour_12 {timestamp} /> Custom Format NOTE : By using custom format settings, the user's defaults will not be loaded and you will have to opt into each unit of information. You can customize how each individual component of the timestamp is displayed via the day, month, weekday, year, hour , minute, and second properties respectively. <script> import {DateTimeStamp} from "@kahi-ui/framework"; const timestamp = "2021-11-10T13:00:42-05:00"; </script> <DateTimeStamp day="2-digit" month="long" weekday="long" year="2-digit" hour="2-digit" minute="2-digit" second="2-digit" hour_12 {timestamp} />

DateTimeStamp.name: timestamp
DateTimeStamp.description: Sets the ISO 8601 / RFC 3339 or UNIX Epoch timestamp being formatted for display.

DateTimeStamp.name: calendar
DateTimeStamp.description: Alters the calendar used for calculations / formatting via Temporal Calendar Codes .

DateTimeStamp.name: locale
DateTimeStamp.description: Alters the locale used for displaying internationalized text via RFC 5646 / BCP 47 language tags.

DateTimeStamp.name: day
DateTimeStamp.description: Alters how a displayed day is formatted.

DateTimeStamp.name: month
DateTimeStamp.description: Alters how a displayed month is formatted.

DateTimeStamp.name: weekday
DateTimeStamp.description: Alters how a displayed weekday is formatted.

DateTimeStamp.name: year
DateTimeStamp.description: Alters how a displayed year is formatted.

DateTimeStamp.name: hour
DateTimeStamp.description: Alters how a displayed hour is formatted.

DateTimeStamp.name: hour_12
DateTimeStamp.description: Alters to showing hours in 12-hour format.

DateTimeStamp.name: minute
DateTimeStamp.description: Alters how a displayed minute is formatted.

DateTimeStamp.name: second
DateTimeStamp.description: Alters how a displayed second is formatted.

data.render:
NOTE: Introduced feature in v0.4.10.

DateTimeStamp formats an ISO 8601 / RFC 3339 timestamp into a human readable string, using the user preferences provided by the Browser.

<script>
    import {DateTimeStamp} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const timestamp = "2021-11-10T13:00:42-05:00";
</script>

<DateTimeStamp {timestamp} />

Imports

<script>
    import {DateTimeStamp} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

12 Hour

You can have the timestamp render as 12-hour time (1...12 AM/PM) instead of 24-hour time (0...23) via the hour_12 property.

<script>
    import {DateTimeStamp} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const timestamp = "2021-11-10T13:00:42-05:00";
</script>

<DateTimeStamp hour="numeric" hour_12 {timestamp} />

Custom Format

NOTE: By using custom format settings, the user's defaults will not be loaded and you will have to opt into each unit of information.

You can customize how each individual component of the timestamp is displayed via the day, month, weekday, year, hour , minute, and second properties respectively.

<script>
    import {DateTimeStamp} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const timestamp = "2021-11-10T13:00:42-05:00";
</script>

<DateTimeStamp
    day="2-digit"
    month="long"
    weekday="long"
    year="2-digit"
    hour="2-digit"
    minute="2-digit"
    second="2-digit"
    hour_12
    {timestamp}
/>
